title-group.article-title: Research Updates on Type 2 Diabetes in Children

contrib.aff: Senior Advisor for Childhood Diabetes Research, National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases, National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, MD
Team Leader, Epidemiology Team, Division of Diabetes Translation, U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Atlanta, GA

abstract.p: Major research trials have provided insight into the scope of type 2 diabetes in youth. The National Diabetes Education Program offers resources to help school nurses support children with or at risk for type 2 diabetes.

fn.label: Authors’ Note
fn.p: The findings and conclusions in this report are those of the authors and do not necessarily represent the official positions of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases.

bio.p: Dr. Linder is the senior advisor for childhood diabetes research at the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases, National Institutes of Health. She also serves on the National Diabetes Education Program’s Children and Adolescents Stakeholder Group.
Dr. Imperatore is a medical epidemiologist and serves as team leader for the Epidemiology Team with the Division of Diabetes Translation at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
